channel.title: Projects on Mauro Taraborelli
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Mauro Taraborelli

item.title: HaskDeep
item.description: HaskDeep is a command line tool, written in Haskell, that computes file hashes traversing recursively through a directory structure. Known hashes are saved to file and they can be used to verify the original files or a copy of them.

item.title: Reproducible Research Assignment - Project 2
item.description:
Project of Reproducible Research course on Coursera, June 2014 edition.

This project involves exploring the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s (NOAA) storm database to answer the following questions:

  1. Across the United States, which types of weather events are most harmful with respect to population health?
  2. Across the United States, which types of weather events have the greatest economic consequences?

item.title: Getting and Cleaning Data Assignment
item.description:
Project of Getting and Cleaning Data course on Coursera, May 2014 edition.

The purpose of this project is to demonstrate the ability to collect, work with, and clean a data set. The goal is to prepare tidy data that can be used for later analysis.

item.title: Data Analysis and Statistical Inference Assignment
item.description:
Project of Data Analysis and Statistical Inference course on Coursera, February 2014 edition.

The project studies the relationship between the highest degree earned by United States residents and their family income in constant dollars.

item.title: Data Analysis Assignment - Project 2

item.title: Photos for Web
item.description: A set of rake tasks to prepare photos for the web using exiftool and Imagemagick.

item.title: SoFoBoMo 2011
item.description: Photobook made with LaTeX and XeTeX for SoFoBoMo 2011 (unfortunately it was the last year of the contest).

item.title: Project Euler Solutions
item.description: Solution to Project Euler problems with Literate Haskell.
